content.description:
Sit start with any combination of holds at the base of the arete. From there, pull up to a big right hand edge, get a foot onto the face, then work up and left on the arete's bumps. Eventually the arete runs out, then traverse left with thin feet, reach the jugs of

Aphelion

, and top it out.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work well. The problem climbs over a clear and flat landing.
content.location: It climbs the southeast arete of Stumble Stone.

content.description:
Vivify climbs a perfect mix of holds on a slight overhang.

Sit start with a left hand on the shelf/jug and a right hand diagonal rail. From there, make a shouldery right hand move to the shelf, move the feet, cross over with the left to a perfect pinch, match a hand next to it, set, work up to a right hand three-finger gaston, bump that hand to an edge, work the feet up, and top it out.
content.protection: A pad will do it. The immediate landing is perfect, but there is a boulder behind the problem. A spot sure would be a welcome protection.
content.location: It climbs the west face of Stumble Stone.

content.description: Stand start matched on an obvious edge. From there, move to the arete, then follow it to the boulder's apex, and mantel atop the boulder.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is sloping and quite nice.
content.location: It climbs the boulder's northeast arete.

content.description:
Squat start with a left hand sloper/sidepull and a  right hand bump/pinch. From there, work straight out and up the overhang on jugs to reach a solid topout.

I trundled several pieces of rock from the problem. Although it's very solid, there are few remaining loose pieces that wouldn't clean up. Bottom line, be cognizant of what you're pulling on.
content.protection: A pair of pads should be good, the landing is very good.
